intro: Nassauvia ulicina, commonly known as redstem nassauvia, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a low-growing shrub that typically reaches heights of 10 to 30 centimeters. The plant features small, showy flowers that are usually pink or red, blooming in clusters during the spring and summer months. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and have a slightly hairy texture. Nassauvia ulicina is often found in rocky soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments.
